meanings.definition: The endurance of pain or hardship without the display of feelings or complaint.
meanings.sent1: Her stoicism during the difficult times inspired everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: His stoicism in the face of adversity was truly admirable.
meanings.sent3: Despite the storm, his stoicism never wavered.
meanings.sent4: The mountain stood with stoicism, unmoved by the passing of time.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's stoicism in battle earned him respect from his comrades.

meanings.definition: An ancient Greek school of philosophy founded by Zeno of Citium, emphasizing the importance of virtue and self-control.
meanings.sent1: Stoicism teaches us to focus on what we can control and let go of the rest.
meanings.sent2: The principles of stoicism have influenced many modern thinkers.
meanings.sent3: In the world of fast fashion, practicing stoicism in shopping can save you money.
meanings.sent4: Her mind became a fortress of stoicism, impervious to distractions.
meanings.sent5: The tree stood tall, embodying the stoicism of ancient wisdom.
